PropertySetDef.Name: AISC_EM11_Pset_TubeNc
PropertySetDef.Definition: Every macro of a part contains a ‘clturn’ and ‘clorigin’ parameter, these parameters determine the position of a macro. The rotation and distance values are relative to the first macro of the part. The ‘clturn’ parameter is the rotation angle between the centerlines of the macros. The ‘clorigin’ is the distance between the centerline intersections of the macros. The section below gives a detailed description of the rotational and translation sign agreement. The definition of the position parameters is explained with the use of a mono sketch of the position that you want to create. A mono sketch is a drawing that shows the part that you want to cut and all the parts or surfaces where the tube has to be connected to. All parameters needed for programming, could be determined using this mono sketch.

PropertyDef.Name: CanOrder
PropertyDef.Definition: Order of the part in a can group. Only useful when a part is part of a can group

PropertyDef.Name: HeatNumber
PropertyDef.Definition: Identifying number issued to the original cast of a metal from which a component is manufactured

PropertyDef.Name: MaxLength
PropertyDef.Definition: The maximum length of the tube. After cutting the part is never longer than this value.

PropertyDef.Name: SeamRotation
PropertyDef.Definition: Angle between seam and the IfcAxis2Placement2D\RefDirection of the profile
